definition: to cultivate one's moral character/(fashion) slim-fit/body-hugging
to decorate/to embellish/to repair/to build/to write/to cultivate/to study/to take (a class)
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
to have an untroubled heart and behave morally (idiom)

sentences.english: Practicing Quan is to calm your mind.
sentences.chinese: 太極拳更重視修身養性，心神安靜。

sentences.english: Not-too-tight skinny jeans make for the perfect date outfit.
sentences.chinese: 不太緊的修身牛仔褲是約會的最佳打扮。

sentences.english: Second, can be self-cultivation, to ease the violent emotions and calm your mind.
sentences.chinese: 可以修身養性，緩解暴戾的情緒，平和你的心態。

sentences.english: Anyone who wants to be a gentleman must cultivate their persons and get to he Heaven by self-training and self-culturing.
sentences.chinese: 人若要達到與誠爲一，則必須透過修身，自反及於天。

sentences.english: Today season trousers is haler and forthright, clipping of cultivate one's morality but be not clingy body.
sentences.chinese: 今季褲子較硬朗豪爽，修身剪裁但並非緊貼身軀。

sentences.english: Random walk down the street, also do not forget to brief paragraph cultivate one's morality dress.
sentences.chinese: 隨意的走在街上，也不忘短款修身連衣裙。

sentences.english: Back to Yoga, Back to my True Life. Namaste!
sentences.chinese: 修身養心，瑜伽是運動，更是生活態度。

sentences.english: Osami Nagano can be beaten, but not without one hell of a scrap.
sentences.chinese: 永野修身也可以被打敗，只不過一場血戰不可避免。

sentences.english: Moral reform is the effort to throw off sleep.
sentences.chinese: 修身養性就是爲擺脫睡眠而付出的努力。

sentences.english: But Osami Nagano, too, has just begun to fight.
sentences.chinese: 不過永野修身也開始戰鬥了。
